subsection.title: Differential equations
subsection.p: The laws of physics are generally written down as differential equations. Therefore, all of science and engineering use differential equations to some degree. Understanding differential equations is essential to understanding almost anything you will study in your science and engineering classes. You can think of mathematics as the language of science, and differential equations are one of the most important parts of this language as far as science and engineering are concerned. As an analogy, suppose all your classes from now on were given in Swahili. It would be important to first learn Swahili, or you would have a very tough time getting a good grade in your classes.

You saw many differential equations already without perhaps knowing about it. And you even solved simple differential equations when you took calculus. Let us see an example you may not have seen:
\frac{dx}{dt} + x = 2 \cos t .
Here x is the dependent variabledependent variable and t is the independent variableindependent variable. Equation is a basic example of a differential equationdifferential equation. In fact, it is an example of a first order differential equationfirst order differential equation, since it involves only the first derivative of the dependent variable. This equation arises from Newton's law of cooling where the ambient temperature oscillates with time.
